profile_positions.title: Research Engineer

company.name: CEA - Commissariat à l'énergie atomique et aux énergies alternatives

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the thesis concerns the evaluation of resistive memories performances for SCM applications, through an in-depth electrical characterization and modeling study. In particular, speed, endurance and consumption will be adressed.

The thesis is constructed as follows:
-Electrical characterization of RRAM memories to identify the most promising stacks and technologies (among OXRAM and CBRAM) for SCM applications. RRAM in planar or vertical architecture will be characterized.
-Advanced electrical characterization to adress the RRAM performance compromises in terms of: speed, consumption and endurance.
-Understanding of these trade off, developing a physical model and identifying the key parameters. Then, proposing a unified RRAM model, describing the memory behavior according to electrical data ( time/voltage programming, endurance, consumption...) This model should allow to identify the best performances a RRAM could offer under optimized consumption programming conditions for a given application.
-Asses the potential of RRAM for SCM applications, compared with initial specifications.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student - Investigation of resistive memories for Storage Class Memory Applications

profile_positions.description: InnovDoc is a team of PhD students from the Université Grenoble Alpes who are willing to work for firms at the end of their PhD thesis. The objectives are to build relationships with the business world by making PhD known and promoting their know-how. Concentrated of expertise and diverse cross-disciplinary skills, Innovdoc provides companies with its analytical and advisory capacity by proposing missions. Spirit of initiative, innovation and dynamism at the service of companies.
profile_positions.title: Communications Team

profile_positions.description:
Modeling, analysis and improvement of the package for high speed serial links used for data processors in networking.

High speed serializers/deserializers (SERDES) are becoming more important and hard to integrate in the circuit projects for the networking. Its integration in a silicon wafer and the posterior inclusion in the package need new solutions and better analysis at electrical and physical level to keep signal integrity and to meet the specifications with the lower costs. To meet such specifications it is important to choose the package in a proper way based in the use of radiofrequencies techniques: transmission and reflection losses, crosstalk, differential impedance, link budget and power integrity.
The internship will consist in a SERDES 28Gbit/s integration in a Ball Grid Array package (BGA). The stages of the project will be the next:
1). Study of a typical configuration for a differential pair in a package: modeling and results analysis.
2). Identification of the elements which have a direct influence in the package performance: transmission line, transition elements (vias, bumps, balls), materials, coupling and isolation.
3). Parametrical study of the structures that could guarantee meeting the specifications with the lower costs to maximize the performances in a determined technology: package layers (number, materials, width…) vias (number, size, placement.)
4). Implementation of a method which will help to take decisions in the future works in these devices related with the products inventory.
The internship will have as target to optimize the performances of the serial links working at 28Gbit/s in the package that integrates them.
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: Set up of a testbench of micropumps made of silicon to be used in biomedical devices. The bench could make diverse tests at electronics and mechanical level. At the end of the internship a user manual was writen by me to ease the work of the next testers of the pumps.

company.name: Yole Intelligence
company.description:
Yole Intelligence is a consulting firm specializing in the strategic analysis of markets, the supply chain, and technological developments related to the semiconductor industry and adjacent industries.
Benefiting from direct access to major players in the field of semiconductors and the multidisciplinary profile (scientific, technical, and market-oriented) of these analysts, we support our clients in the understanding of markets, the evolution of technologies, and their implementation in industry. The company provides its expertise through regular analyses and advice in strategic marketing and technical analysis.
